intro: Viscum costatum, commonly known as the creeping mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various trees and shrubs. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its berries, which are typically red or yellow, are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Viscum costatum plays a role in ecological systems by providing nourishment to animals and contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
